library.title: The Storied Life of A.J. Fikry
library.author: Gabrielle Zevin
library.synopsis: A.J. Fikry. Lonely, depressed, and on the brink of poverty his anger was the only thing he'd kept hold of. That all changes in the blink of an eye. This book shows many lessons that anyone can grasp, grow from, or pass along.

library.title: Archer's Voice
library.author: Mia Sheridan
library.synopsis: Bree was looking for peace. Archer was an overlooked man dealing with trauma. One day, everything changed. Bree found the complete opposite and Archer was finally seen.

library.title: My Dark Vanessa
library.author: Katie Elizabeth Russell
library.synopsis: This book is no walk in the park. Full of little details leaving a big mark, My Dark Vanessa is a peek into the world of a young woman deceived, broken, and confused from her manipulated teenage years.

library.title: The Giver
library.author: Lois Lowry
library.synopsis: In this futuristic utopia, true emotions of happiness or pain are forbidden. Chosen from one who has experienced all, Jonas was given the power to embrace the hidden.

library.title: Babel
library.author: R.F. Kuang
library.synopsis: Cover to cover, Babel’s impressive integration of student rebellion, tests of language and linguistics, and clashing of colonial studies is so ambitiously written by the end you will lack words to describe but be overflowing with emotion.

library.title: Verity
library.author: Colleen Hoover
library.synopsis: Some things are not always as they seem. If you notice anything off, nine times out of ten it is. This book will leave you stuck in the middle thinking who to believe, questioning if anyone is sane. What would you do?

library.title: We Were Liars
library.author: E. Lockhart
library.synopsis: Everything is fine. Everything is always fine. They are Sinclair’s. Until the dishonesty begins to catch up with the mislead. The plot is indescribable, unforeseen, and suspenseful. Truly a must-read.

library.title: The Cellar
library.author: Natasha Preston
library.synopsis: You think you live in a normal town, with normal people, and have a normal life. What if that isn’t the case? So much can be hidden under the ordinary routine.  Summer Robinson experiences firsthand how not normal someone can be.

library.title: Tomorrow and Tomorrow and Tomorrow
library.author: Gabrielle Zevin
library.synopsis: In love but never lovers, Sadie and Sam, go on quite the adventure through life expressing all the emotions that come with it through the builds of their video games. Peaks, valleys, and everything in between accurately depict growth that can only happen within the act of time.

library.title: Atomic Habits
library.author: James Clear
library.synopsis: No matter your cycles, routines, and customs James Clear provides excellent incite on how to create, break, and transform habits. Even the smallest of details can make a world of difference.

library.title: The Office of Historical Corrections
library.author: Danielle Evans
library.synopsis: These short but impactful stories beautifully written by Danielle Evans generate a voice expressing the good and bad of grief, race, and American history

library.title: Fourth Wing
library.author: Rebecca Yarros
library.synopsis: Boredom is no such thing once you dive into the world of Fourth Wing. This elite and vicious book will put you into a different universe as if you too are in a war college for dragon riders.
